comment: Smart Data Models - Measurement adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.EnergyCIM/master/Measurement/schema.json
description: Adapted from CIM data models. A Measurement represents any measured, calculated or non-measured non-calculated quantity. Any piece of equipment may contain Measurements, e.g. a substation may have temperature measurements and door open indications, a transformer may have oil temperature and tank pressure measurements, a bay may contain a number of power flow measurements and a Breaker may contain a switch status measurement.  The PSR - Measurement association is intended to capture this use of Measurement a

contents.name: PowerSystemResource
contents.comment: The measurements associated with this power system resource. Default: None

contents.name: Terminal
contents.comment: One or more measurements may be associated with a terminal in the network. Default: None

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: measurementType
contents.comment: Specifies the type of measurement.  For example, this specifies if the measurement represents an indoor temperature, outdoor temperature, bus voltage, line flow, etc. Default: ''

contents.name: phases
contents.comment: Indicates to which phases the measurement applies and avoids the need to use `measurementType` to also encode phase information (which would explode the types). The phase information in Measurement, along with `measurementType` and `phases` uniquely defines a Measurement for a device, based on normal network phase. Their meaning will not change when the computed energizing phasing is changed due to jumpers or other reasons. If the attribute is missing three phases (ABC) shall be assumed. Default: None

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: unitMultiplier
contents.comment: The unit multiplier of the measured quantity. Default: None

contents.name: unitSymbol
contents.comment: The unit of measure of the measured quantity. Default: None

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)
